class_notes:
(Content: Readings in American literature from the Civil War to the present, with attention to historical and cultural contexts. By the end of the course, students should have a good sense of the movements, writers, and ideas shaping American literature from 1865 to the beginning of the 21st century. Lecture and discussion. This course does not satisfy a writing requirement.
Texts: The Norton Anthology of American Literature, 1865 to the Present (Shorter Ninth Edition: ISBN: 978-0-393-26453-1); William Faulkner, Absalom, Absalom! (ISBN 978-0-679-73218-1); Toni Morrison, Beloved (Penguin/Random House: ISBN 9781400033416). 
Work: 2 tests (15% each); unannounced reading quizzes/in-class and out-of-class reflections, some requiring research (35%); final exam (cumulative, 25%); attendance and participation (10%). All work (except for in-class quizzes and reflections on days when you are absent) must be completed in order to pass the course.)
course_description: Readings in American literature from 1865 to the present, with attention to cultural and historical backgrounds.
